description: Eastleigh sign midfielder Harry Pell from AFC Wimbledon after his Dons contract was cancelled by mutual consent.
title: Harry Pell: Eastleigh sign midfielder from AFC Wimbledon
title_page: Harry Pell: Eastleigh sign midfielder from AFC Wimbledon - BBC Sport
maintext:
Harry Pell has joined Eastleigh from AFC Wimbledon after his contract was cancelled by mutual consent.
The midfielder has struggled for first-team football this season, making just two starts for Neal Ardley's side and going on loan at Grimsby.
The 23-year-old joined Wimbledon from Hereford in January 2013 and made 65 appearances in total for the club.
"Harry has spoken to me twice recently and said he was frustrated about a lack of opportunities," said Ardley.
"When Eastleigh contacted us about his availability, it was agreed that it would be in the interest of both parties to allow the player to leave.
"Harry made a great start in his first season with us and he played a key role in keeping us in the Football League. We wish him well at Eastleigh."
Pell started his professional career with Bristol Rovers and also had a spell at Cambridge United.
